did.unittitle: Duke Student Engineers' Wives Club records
did.abstract: The Duke Student Engineers' Wives Club was formed in 1949 for the wives of engineering students as a social organization. The collection includes a scrapbook, photograph album of the children of club members, and a few materials related to the operations of the club in the 1950s.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the University Archives to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for official university records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

Finding aid derived from MARC record, November 2014; edited to include UA2015-0045, September 2015.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Duke Student Engineers' Wives Club was formed in 1949 for the wives of engineering students, to provide opportunities to participate in and benefit from college life, to maintain and cultivate good fellowship among its members, and to stimulate an interest in and service to the community. The organization held regular bi-monthly meetings, organized social activities and seminars for members and their husbands, ran a hot dog concession at the annual engineers show, and invited speakers from the University community to address the club.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection includes a scrapbook consisting largely of photographs which document the activities of the Club between 1949-1956, a photograph album of members' and former members' children and birth announcements, and some documents related to the activities of the club in the 1950s. Documents include the club's constitution, copies of diplomas given to members upon their husbands' graduation celebrating the contributions of the wives' to their husbands' studies, and meeting minutes describing event planning and other matters.

controlaccess.subject: Electrical engineers' spouses -- North Carolina -- Durham
